It is characterized by its creeping growth habit, with stolons that allow it to spread along the soil surface. The plant exhibits a thalloid structure, consisting of a flattened, ribbon-like body that is often covered in small, scale-like structures. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in rocky or forested areas with high humidity. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
